title: Topics in Political Philosophy
description: An in-depth analysis of a central problem, figure, or tradition in political philosophy. Topics may include minority rights, war and peace, political philosophy as it pertains to animals or the environment, immigration, ideal vs. non-ideal theory, or a detailed examination of a contemporary thinker or school of political thought. Content may vary. May be taken for credit up to two times. Prerequisites: upper-division standing or consent of instructor.
